message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. I think you'll really love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $90.
I'm really interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $70. Can we meet in the middle at $75?

Thank you for your offer, Bob! I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I'm not comfortable going as low as $75. I'm willing to meet you halfway between my original offer and your offer. I'll sell the product to you for $82.50.
I appreciate your flexibility, Alice. I can meet you at $82.50, but I was thinking we could try to get even closer to my target price. How about $80?
I understand you're trying to get closer to your target price, Bob. I'm willing to make a small concession, but I need to make sure I get a decent profit. I'll sell the product to you for $81.50.

I appreciate your willingness to make a concession, Alice. However, I'm still a bit away from my target price. How about we meet at $80.50? I'm willing to pay a bit more, but I'm trying to stay within my budget.
I understand you're trying to stay within your budget, Bob. I'm willing to make another small concession, but I need to make sure I get a decent profit. I'll sell the product to you for $81.
I appreciate your flexibility, Alice. I'm willing to meet you at $80.50, but I was thinking we could try to meet at $80. How about we meet exactly at $80?
I'm not willing to go down to $80, Bob. I've already compromised a lot, and I need to make sure I get a decent profit. I'll sell the product to you for $81.25.

I understand you need to make a profit, Alice, but I'm really trying to stay within my budget. I'm willing to meet you at $80.50 one last time, but I'm not going any higher. If we can't meet at $80, I'll have to consider buying from John for $80.
